title: Pain-wracked face of pet beagle who was skinned alive then left to die in street
text:
A beagle had to be put down after she was found with the skin pulled off three quarters of her body. The animal was attacked last week after escaping from her owners’ yard while they were out of town (Pictures: City of Neosho PD/Google Maps)

This harrowing photo shows the anguished face of a pet beagle who was skinned alive then left to die in the street.

The tortured dog, who was in so much pain she could barely raise her head, was found with three quarters of her skin yanked from her body in Neosho, Missouri last week.

She was attacked after escaping her enclosure while her owners were away, with an opportunistic animal abuser striking soon after.

Police were called by horrified residents who spotted the anguished dog.

They rushed the pet to a local veterinarian, who put the beagle to sleep to end her suffering.

The City of Neosho Police Department has released an edited photo of the dog to try and find eyewitnesses who may have seen her killer.

A small section of the horrific injuries inflicted on the animal is visible towards her hind legs.

Amanda Good, from the Missouri branch of the Humane Society of the United States said: ‘It takes a truly callous person to skin a dog alive and it’s completely heartbreaking to imagine the suffering this dog endured.

‘We hope that this reward will encourage anyone with information about this terrible crime to come forward, not only to help seek justice for this animal, but also to ensure the safety of the entire community.’

Locals raised $3,000 towards a reward leading for information, with the Humane Society adding another $5,000 on top.

Police said the animal was well cared-for by her owners, with a spokesman adding: ‘The animal either escaped from the assault or was set free in this condition.
